title: Battery-storage costs must drop by 15 pc per year for India to avoid adding new coal capacity: Report
description: India could avoid new coal plants if battery-storage costs decrease by 15% annually, according to a report by Ember and TERI. The nation, which currently relies on coal for 75% of its electricity, could limit coal capacity to 2032 planned levels, supporting its net-zero emissions goal by 2070.
